author: Shannon Molloy National TV Writer
title: House Rules finale: ‘useless’ renovators vs design gurus in hot contest |
text:
DESPITE being “hopeless” renovators who only just managed to scrape by each week, a father-daughter duo are within spitting distance of a major reality TV windfall.
Steve and Tiana Falzon from Sydney’s west will find out tonight if they’ve won the House Rules grand finale , which would see the family’s mortgage fully paid off.
They’re the first to admit they severely struggled in early parts of the competition, but they’ve come a long way and now feel they’re serious contenders to win the ultimate life-changing prize.
Most improved ... they struggled for a long time but Steve and Tiana finally hit their stride in House Rules. Source: News Corp Australia
“Dad’s been working really hard since mum passed away and it’s his turn to get some good things out of life,” Tiana, 26, said.
They’re up against Queensland glamour couple Ben Edgeworth and Danielle Russell , who were hot favourites to win from the start of the season.
“I really want to win this for Danielle,” Ben, 32, said. “She poured everything she had into this competition and I’d love to see her rewarded for every sleepless night and every tear she shed.”
Worthy finalists ... Ben Edgeworth and Danielle Russell are design gurus who will be hard to beat in the House Rules grand finale. Picture: Tara Croser. Source: News Corp Australia
The latest season of the Channel Seven reality show has been “the most dramatic ever”, according to host Johanna Griggs.
“It was a bit like being in the movie Mean Girls at time,” she laughed.
“The competition really ramped up towards the end and it was pretty full on. It’s like the teams all of a sudden remembered it was a competition with this life-changing prize.”
Can’t pick ... House Rules host Johanna Griggs won’t tip a winner for Monday’s grand finale, saying both teams have a strong chance. Source: Supplied
That realisation seemed to have the biggest impact on the New South Wales team , she said, who finally “pulled their fingers out” and got serious about the opportunity.
“It’s safe to say Steve and Tiana had their bags packed for the first few eliminations. They were hopeless — totally hopeless. Then they hit their straps and turned it around.
“They’ve done some brilliant work. It’s amazing to see the transformation, from one of the weakest teams we’ve ever had in this show to real contenders.”
Amazing turnaround ... Steve and Tiana’s transformation from weak competitors to real contenders was remarkable. Source: Supplied
But beating the talented Queensland renovators will be a big ask, Griggs said.
“They’re very strong, they’re consistent, they’re good. I picked Ben and Danielle for the finals from the beginning.”
Steve said winning would allow him to spend more time with his young son, while Ben and Danielle said the strong financial position would allow them to start a family.
Good opportunity ... winning the House Rules ultimate prize would allow Ben and Danielle the financial freedom to start a family. Source: Supplied
Scores from the judges and a public vote will decide the outcome, with the results delivered live tonight.
The House Rules grand finale airs tonight at 7.30pm on Channel Seven.
Originally published as ’Hopeless’ duo could win huge TV prize
